data.title: Rita Wilson
data.meta_description: Rita Wilson (born Margarita Ibrahimoff; October 26, 1956)[1] appeared as Nurse Lacey in two episodes of the CBS-TV series M*A*S*H, in the Season 11 episodes "Hey, Look Me Over" and "Blood and Guts". A former teen child actress and producer, Rita is best known as being the wife of Academy...
data.text:
Rita Wilson (born Margarita Ibrahimoff; October 26, 1956)[1] appeared as Nurse Lacey in two episodes of the CBS-TV series M*A*S*H, in the Season 11 episodes "Hey, Look Me Over" and "Blood and Guts". A former teen child actress and producer, Rita is best known as being the wife of Academy Award-winning film star Tom Hanks.

Career[]

Rita began her career on the ABC-TV sitcom series The Brady Bunch. Other television appearances include guest spots on Frasier, Happy Days, and Curb Your Enthusiasm, and the HBO original miniseries From the Earth to the Moon.

Production work[]

A producer for such films as My Big Fat Greek Wedding, Wilson has also appeared on Broadway in Chicago, and in the feature films Sleepless in Seattle with husband Hanks and Meg Ryan, Jingle All the Way with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Phil Hartman, and comedian/actor Sinbad, Psycho, and Autofocus.

Personal life[]

She has been married to actor Tom Hanks since April 1988, and the couple have two sons, Chester (born 4 August 1990) and Truman Theodore (born 26 December 1995). She also has two stepchildren from Tom Hanks' previous marriage to late actress Samantha Lewes, star actor Colin Hanks and his sister Elizabeth Ann.
